newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA M1 RISES 5.61 PCT,M2 UP 12.06 PCT IN WEEK.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA M1 RISES 5.61 PCT,M2 UP 12.06 PCT IN WEEK.

text.p: Bulgarian M1 money supply rose to 180.8 billion levs on December 6 from 171.2 billion levs on November 29 and M2 increased to 1,084.4 billion levs from 967.7 billion levs, preliminary central bank figures showed.

Total broad money rose 12.05 percent to 1,138.5 billion levs as lev-denominated broad money edged up 2.23 percent to 544.9 billion levs and dollar-denominated broad money increased 22.87 percent to 593.6 billion levs.
Hard currency-denominated deposits of companies totalled $759.9 million on December 6, up $35.6 million in the week.
Individuals withdrew some $5.5 million worth of foreign currency-denominated deposits last week, bringing the total to $526.7 million on December 6.
Lev-denominated term deposits of companies and individuals rose to 308.7 billion levs on December 6 from 306.2 billion levs a week earlier. -- Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
